intro: Eugenia boqueronensis, commonly known as the Boquerón eugenia, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to the Andean region of South America, specifically Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers and oval-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Its ornamental value has made it a subject of interest in horticulture and botanical research.
